meanings.sent1: The teacher chivied the students to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: She chivied her brother to clean his room before their parents came home.
meanings.sent3: The little bird chivied the sleepy cat, trying to get it to play.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain chivied the campers to seek shelter in their tents.
meanings.sent5: The annoying alarm clock chivied him out of bed every morning.

meanings.definition: To urge or prod someone into action.
meanings.sent1: The coach chivied the players to give their best performance in the game.
meanings.sent2: He chivied his friend to join him on the adventure trip.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of baking cookies chivied him to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker chivied the audience to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset chivied them to stay a little longer at the beach.
